newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq sets record; blue chips down for second day.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq sets record; blue chips down for second day.

text.p: The Nasdaq market set its fourth record in a row Wednesday amid strength in technology stocks, while blue-chip stocks fell for a second day as investors took profits ahead of the Thanksgiving holiday.
Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average fell 29.07 points to 6,499.34, while the Nasdaq Composite index was up 6.12 points at a record of 1,287.32.
In the broader market, advancing issues led declines by a small margin on moderate volume of 380 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
